event_context.catalyst: Fifth Third Bancorp acquisition of Comerica (Shareholder Approved)
event_context.note: Shareholders approved Jan 6-7, 2026. Closing expected Q1 2026.

failures.note: Spread compressed to 0.90% following shareholder approval. Offer value $93.28 (1.8663x FITB) vs Price $92.45. Upside is minimal relative to residual regulatory risk.

thesis_assessment.bull_case: Deal is effectively done (shareholder approved). 0.9% spread is 'free money' if it closes quickly. Combined entity creates 9th largest US bank.
thesis_assessment.bear_case: Spread of 0.9% offers insufficient buffer for any unforeseen regulatory delay or macro shock. All-stock nature exposes holder to FITB downside. Framework requires >2.5% to justify capital allocation.
thesis_assessment.framework_view: Classic 'too late' setup. The arbitrage opportunity has been arbed away. The framework avoids picking up pennies in front of steamrollers.

lessons_learned: Post-shareholder approval spreads often compress below the 2.5% hurdle.
Bank merger kill screens (Tier 1/NPL) remain effective health checks even when the primary failure is the spread.
All-stock deal spreads fluctuate with the acquirer's price, requiring real-time calculation.
